channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Refuge shelter, 24th June
item.description:
137, Tennyson Road, Cheltenham. This refuge/ bin shelter has been in place for over a month.

Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement

item.description:

item.title: Missing/obscured public footpath sign, 24th June
item.description:
The public footpath sign outside Jasmine Cottage on Bushcombe Lane is missing or obscured by vegetation/hedge owned by the cottage. Vegetation either needs to be cut back or a new sign installed to make it obvious that this is a public path.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bushcombe Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown vegetation along path., 24th June
item.description:
Footpath between fields with horses is heavily overgrown by vegetation and needs cutting back. Fences both sides prevent walking around the affected section. Please cut back vegetation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gambles Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown path, 24th June
item.description:

item.title: Cut myself on barbed wire when trying to use the designated footpath. All footpath signs also removed from the top of branch road., 24th June
item.description:
Footpath is blocked by barbed wire and all signs signifying it goes through York Barn field have been removed. I tried to use it but cut all my leg on the barbed wire.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Golden Valley Junction, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cotswold Way blocked by two portable barriers., 24th June
item.description:
Cotswold Way blocked by two portable barriers, at the point where it makes a right angle turn, away from the main road. No notice or explanation of the reason. No actual problem in walking the path beyond the barriers. This was observed Sunday 15 June.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crickley Hill, Birdlip, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Highways have ignored multiple large, deep potholes & fixed one tiny one, 24th June
item.description:
Highways have ignored multiple large, deep potholes & fixed one tiny one. I’ve then received an email to say that the problem has been rectified. But very large, deep potholes are still all over this road. How can this possibly be cost effective to ignore multiple problems and fix one small hole only?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cirencester Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
